In addition to age, chronic health conditions such as renal failure, diabetes, hypertension, and heart disease are major risk factors for developing more severe symptoms of COVID‐19.
18 Patients with asthma (particularly severe or uncontrolled asthma) and immunodeficiency have also been classified to be at increased risk of developing more severe COVID‐19, based more on common sense rather than mounting evidence.
19 However, recently, the CDC in the United States released a Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report which suggested that adults with a history of asthma were more likely to be hospitalized with COVID‐19; those hospitalized with COVID‐19 had a higher rate of a history of asthma (17.0%) than the general population (7.7%).
